content: So these are imap accounts. Are they all the same mail provider? Are the filters server based, or Thunderbird based? Please give complete details of at least one of the filter rules
creator: wsmwk

content:
Yes, Wayne, all imap accounts, sorry to have not specified that.

Sorry - I annoyingly repeat a few items following, just for in-stream clarity...

| Are they all the same mail provider?

Multiple mail providers including: 1. Four addresses at one of my own domains at hosting.com, one of which gets the majority of the traffic 2. Two addresses at two more of my own domains at hosting.com, 3. Two more addresses, one each at two more domains at hosting.com 4. Two addresses at an organization's domain I manage at Siteground have their own Thunderbird mailboxes, and 5. Several other addresses at the same domain which resides on the Siteground server forward directly to the main address at my domain at hosting.com * 6. Three gmail accounts


| Are the filters server based, or Thunderbird based?

Hmmm... The filters are all set up in Thunderbird, and I'm not aware of the ability to have them resident on either the server or Thunderbird per se, but the *results* of the filters vary: a (very) few filters actually download messages to Local Folders on my laptop, but since that means I could easily lose those in a hardware crash or update (ignoring backups), most of the filters file messages on server-based folders, of which there are a LOT.

  • The rogue Folder BS has now stored messages originating from some or all of the sources listed above. I should add that legit BS-related traffic is focused around traffic generated by the organization's domain hosted at Siteground per 4. above, and forwarded to a server-based folder in the mailbox for the most heavily used address in 1. above. The problem is that Folder BS is now sucking up messages with zero relevance to BS, so my hunch is that this is a Thunderbird directory database glitch, but I only have <50% confidence in the usefulness of that hunch.


| Please give complete details of at least one of the filter rules

Keeping in mind that the rogue Folder BS continues to absorb messages without my active approval since the last version of Filter BS was deleted sometime after 11/14/25, those filters would have had rules along these lines:

√ Match any of the following <From, To, Cc or Bcc> contains bs <Subject> contains bs

Perform these actions: Move Message to <Folder BS> (which is a server-based folder 2 levels below the inbox, with 2 levels of sub-folders within it for annual and monthly filing.)


Also keep in mind that I've searched all the filters for the actual text BS stands for and found no other matches since deleting Filter BS. (That said, I'm not clear that the search function in the Message Filters window searches anything other than the names of the filters...)


I just examined the Filter log, which spans 6/9/25 through today, 1/16/26. The results show that: • "Filter*BS" ran 41 times between 6/16/25 and 10/8/25 I identified enough incorrectly filed messages in Folder BS during that time period to know that I would have been so frustrated with the problem that I apparently deleted that filter and created a new version, with slightly different actions required (no tagging or priority change, just moving the message to Folder BS). • "Filter BS" ran 38 times between 10/17/25 and 11/14/25 Once again, I identified enough incorrectly filed messages in Folder BS during that time period to know that I still hadn't solved the problem by deleting and replacing the filter. And once again, I deleted the filter in frustration, and did not replace it. • Entries including the path to Folder BS appear only 79 times between 6/16/25 and 11/14/25, but there are more than 171 messages in Folder BS between those dates - about double what should be there. • Messages inappropriately filed in Folder BS were received as recently as yesterday, despite the continuing fact that There. Is. No. Filter. Set. To. Perform. That. Move.

I hope that provides some clarity... many thanks for any thoughts you can offer.

John

content: I presume an IMAP account, as POP only retrieves from inbox. If there are messages in a folder other than the inbox, highlight the folder, rightclick, select properties, and tick to check this folder when retrieving messages. If I misunderstood your issue, please clarify. thank you
creator: davidsk

content:
david said
I presume an IMAP account, as POP only retrieves from inbox. If there are messages in a folder other than the inbox, highlight the folder, rightclick, select properties, and tick to check this folder when retrieving messages. If I misunderstood your issue, please clarify. thank you

Sorry for the late reply. I didn't know about that setting. After doing a little research, I found that changing this to true would be the same. I want to receive emails in all folders. Are there any disadvantages?
creator: kaikakw

content: The only disadvantage I see is the use of extra PC and network resources to check folders that you know will never have new messages. If every folder in the account may have new content, then you need that feature. Otherwise, I would select only those that would.

content: Final update: I discovered that if there is a service listening on port 80 (localhost) then this snaffles the authentication request. I have Apache running; disabling this and retrying solved the problem
creator: davidhealer4

content:
Hi Jesper,

The error was trying to re-use the previous account and just changing some settings. One has to add the new account, transfer messages from the old account either to local folders or the new account, and then disable or delete the old account.

The new account seems to be an IMAP account. Is it? IMAP synchronizes folders with the server. When you had your inbox and other folders access the new account, those folders were synchronized with the new account.

But I do not understand why you can find messages from the old account by searching for them or why the names of all the folders are preserved in the folderTree.json file. So my diagnosis could be wrong.

I believe that you have two options:

  1. Re-connect to the old account if you still can, and start this process over.
  2. Restore from a back-up.

Maybe a third option: if your old account was a POP account, I understand that those messages are still on your local drive. Was it a POP account?
creator: mozilla98

content:
Poškozený index složky (NEJČASTĚJŠÍ PŘÍČINA). Thunderbird má zprávy fyzicky stažené, ale index složky je rozbitý.

Postup (bezpečný – o maily nepřijdete): Pravým tlačítkem klikněte na složku Doručená pošta (Inbox) u účtu Atlas Zvolte Vlastnosti Klikněte na Opravit složku Potvrďte a vyčkejte (může trvat i několik minut) Restartujte Thunderbird

Ve většině případů se zprávy okamžitě objeví.

content:
Je to od AI: Chování odpovídá známému problému v TB 146.x na Windows 11 po importu profilu ze starší ESR verze. SMTP část proběhne korektně (mail je odeslaný), ale selže nebo neproběhne IMAP „APPEND“ do složky Odeslané. TB pak čeká v modálním stavu „Odesílám…“ a uživatel musí dát Storno. Projevuje se hlavně při migraci 140.x ESR → 146.x a jen na nových Windows 11.

Pro upřesnění řešení 1. Jaký je provider (Seznam/Gmail/M365/vlastní IMAP). 2. Je Sent mapovaná na IMAP nebo Lokální? 3. Jak proběhl import (kopie AppData vs. TB Import).

content:
Kedves Gábor!

Konkrétan ugyanazt a funkcionalitást nem tudja az androidos alkalmazás, de a beérkezett üzeneteket tudod egyesített módon kezelni.

A Beállítások -> Általános beállítások -> Megjelenés oldalon, a Fióklista szakaszban kapcsold be az Egységes beérkezett üzenetek megjelenítése lehetőséget. Ezután ez is megjelenik a fióklistában. Lásd a mellékelt képeket.

Üdv, Balázs
creator: meskobalazs

content:
Kedves Balázs! Köszönöm a gyors és hasznos információt.

Észleltem, hogy a nehézség egy része a szövegezésből származhatott. A felületen olvasható szöveg: "Egységes beérkezett üzenetek megjelenítése" Ami magyarul egységes beérkezést jelent, Ezen szöveg helyett javaslom a következőt: "Üzenetek együttes és egységes megjelenítése"

Üdvözlettel, Gábor
creator: makaragb

content:
Kedves Gábor!

A javaslatoddal az a gondom, hogy azt sugallja, hogy az összes mappára vonatkozik, pedig valójában csak és kizárólag a Beérkezett üzenetek mappára (az esetleges almappák tartalmát sem tartalmazza).

Mindenesetre átírtam erre: Beérkezett üzenetek egyesített megjelenítése, mert már több helyen az egyesített szót használta az alkalmazás.

Üdv, Balázs
creator: meskobalazs

content:
Yes, this kind of filter should work in Thunderbird.

After you select Tools > Message filters and then select the name of the filter, what folder is set for it to operate on (bottom of the window)?

There seems to be quirks in Thunderbirds message filtering. If you create a filter to run on Folder A, then run it manually when you are looking at Folder B, Thunderbird changes the folder that it is set to operate on.

You may find other useful information here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters

content:
I wouldn't think the "Periodically..." option would be necessary, since the filter has already checked the message during fetching. Also, I'm surprised the filter works when you manually run it, even though the "Manually Run" option is disabled.

I would create a test filter identical to this one but use Subject criteria like "TESTTEST1", "TESTTEST2", "TESTTEST3", and send myself some test messages to see if they work. I might also change the action to something else, like 'Tag Message' or 'Move Message To'.

There is the "Filter Log" feature that you can enable in the Message Filters dialog that might show where things are going wrong.

content: Is it possible that once when you quit Thunderbird you had left open an email account in a second Thunderbird window? This might explain the second window on startup since Thunderbird automatically proceeds to a session restore: on next start it opens the same windows which were open at the end of the last session when you quit. To get rid of the superfluous window simply close it before leaving Thunderbird

content:
In whatever version of Thunderbird was current a year ago, I often experienced a strange problem. Thunderbird opened a window behind the one that I was using. I forget what triggered it. I may have been navigating to account settings. If I recall correctly, it happened sometimes even when I was just moving the mouse pointer, but I'm no longer sure of that.

It happened less over time. I have not seen it happen in several months now, I think, except maybe once. I downgraded to 140 esr about a month ago. I have not see it happen since then.

So, I can only guess that this problem could be related to the version of Thunderbird that you are using.
creator: mozilla98

content: If Eclipse is shutting down, I expect anyone attempting to send you an email there will have it rejected/returned because Eclipse won't be there to redirect - and that only works when an email provider has that feature. Your survival strategy needs to be sending emails to everyone you care about with the new email address. That's the best you can do. As far as transferring the messages, That's probably best done by you.If volume is small, you may be able to simply highlight the account folders, rightclick and select 'COPY to' the gmail account. (NEVER use move for IMAP to IMAP.) A safe way is to use file>offline>download to ensure you capture all messages, use the addon, importexporttools NG to highlight folder, righclick, export to mbox file, and then highlight Local Folders, rightclick and use the importexportoption to import mbox. That gets the messages safely to your PC, Check that you have all the content, not just headers. Now, you can highlight the local messages, select COPY to ' the gmail folders. If there are thousands of messages, I suggest using a manual filter to regulate the transfer.
creator: davidsk

content:
I found an article which is nearly correct. Here is my correct solution:

Turn off and disable ALL junk filtering

1. Go to account name at upper left, above Inbox and below “+New Message”. 2. Right click on that 3.Go to “Settings” which is the last entry in the drop down menu. 4. Go to “Junk Settings” 5. UNCHECK “Enable adaptive junk mail controls for this account” 6. Go back later and confirm that the box is still uncecked. 7. Go further down to “Junk Settings” in “Local Folders” and do the same thing (usually this is the same screen as before and usually will be unchecked already).

The article at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1061256#answer-726506 has nearly correct instructions.
creator: slemberg

content:
Jan Hajduch said
Since today or yesterday, my Thunderbird has stopped refreshing the list of messages. The number of new/unread messages in the Inbox and other folders is shown and updated right but the main window with the list of the messages does not get refreshed and only shows the last message from couple days ago.

Did you activate the Quick Filter toolbar by inadvertance?

Jan Hajduch said
I've tried to follow a bunch of guides and ideas (repairing folder, deleting .msf files...) and even removed the account and tried adding it again. The list of folders is right but now there are no messages at all. All folders look empty.

Can you see the messages of this account when you open webmail?

Jan Hajduch said
I've found out that in the folder on the disc where there are supposed to be the "INBOX.msf" and "INBOX" files, that the "INBOX" file without the file type is missing. And it's the same with every message folder, there are only .msf files on my PC where I removed and re-added the account.

This is normal if you disabled ⬜︎ "Keep messages in all folders for this account on this computer" in Account settings > Synchronisation & Storage > Message Synchronising (see images) By default this option is activated.

Does the same issue persist if you start Thunderbird in "troubleshoot mode"? https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird
creator: Mapenzi
